fake_productivity.text: You're trying to open [site] at [time]. Quick honesty check: is this genuinely urgent, or are you wearing a productivity costume to avoid going to bed?
That [site] task will take you 20 minutes tonight with a tired brain. Or 7 minutes tomorrow with a fresh one. Which sounds smarter?
You know what's more productive than editing a doc at [time]? Sleeping. Literally. Your brain solves problems in REM sleep. Free productivity. Just close the laptop.
Late-night 'productivity' has a name: it's called procrastinating on sleep while feeling responsible. We see you.
If your boss texted you right now and said 'stop working, go to sleep' â€” would you listen? Consider this that text.
Nothing on [site] is going to collapse overnight. But your energy tomorrow will if you don't sleep. Priorities?
Fun fact: decisions made after 11 PM are statistically worse than decisions made at 9 AM. Maybe save that [site] session for when your brain is actually online?

playful_roast.text: It's [time]. Your alarm is set for [wake_time]. This is the part of the movie where the audience screams DON'T DO IT.
You're trying to open [site] at [time]. Your pillow is RIGHT THERE. It's warm. It misses you. Don't do this to it.
Future-you is watching from tomorrow morning. Future-you has bags under their eyes. Future-you blames this exact moment.
You installed a sleep extension. You literally asked for this intervention. And now you're trying to dodge it. The irony is *chef's kiss*.
You've been caught trying to open [site] at [time]. How do you plead?

cost_calculator.text: You have [hours_left] hours until your alarm. Every minute here trades REM sleep for screen time. REM is where creativity lives. Still worth it?
30 min of late-night screen time = roughly 20% less focus tomorrow. That's not made up. That's what sleep research says. Your call.
If you sleep now: [hours_left] hours of sleep. If you stay for 'just 30 minutes': that minus 30 min of sleep + regret. The math is simple.
Every hour of lost sleep costs you approximately 2 hours of productive work tomorrow. You're about to make an expensive trade.

identity_nudge.text: The version of you who wakes up at [wake_time] and owns the morning? They're asleep right now. Join them.
Every night you protect your sleep is a vote for the person you actually want to be. What's tonight's vote?
You're [streak] nights into your streak. That's not luck. That's a pattern becoming a lifestyle. Keep it going?
Small decisions compound. This one 'close tab' click tonight is worth more than you think.

absurd_funny.text: In the entire history of humanity, nobody has ever woken up and said 'I'm so glad I stayed up until 2 AM on [site].' Be the exception? Or be smart?
If your future self could send you one text right now, it would just say: 'bro.'
This is attempt #[attempt_count] tonight. At what point do we admit this is a pattern and not a coincidence?
Pick one: (A) 8 hours of sleep and an awesome tomorrow, or (B) whatever's on [site] that you'll forget in 12 seconds. Choose wisely.
Your laptop doesn't need you right now. It's a machine. It has no feelings. Go to bed. It'll be fine.
